# Arpeggio: Minor Major 7th in C (Shape: A)

## Brief Presentation
The Minor Major 7th arpeggio is a unique and expressive arpeggio that consists of notes from the C Minor Major 7th chord. When played in the "A" shape, it offers a distinct and evocative sound that can add color and emotion to musical compositions.

## Notes and Intervals

- Root (C)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor Major 7th arpeggio is often used in jazz, fusion, and other genres that explore complex harmonies and rich textures. Its melancholic yet sophisticated flavor adds depth and sophistication to compositions, making it a favorite among musicians looking to convey complex emotions through their music.
